page.title: 15Agriculture.
page.content: The vast majority of the farmland in the area is given over to crops. Farms are in general large and highly mechanised. There has been a tendency in recent years to increase the size of individual fields so as to maximise the productivity of the land. As livestock are not generally kept there is no need to maintain hedgerows or other field boundaries; in many cases there are no boundaries between roads and fields. A variety of crops are crops are grown - wheat is particularly important especially due to the high level of subsidies currently available. Rape is a crop that is increasing in importance. Grass sometimes forms part of a crop rotation system and is usually cut for hay. Little labour is required on the farms of the area due to the high degree of mechanisation.
